events.name: Movimiento de camara para el libro

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RepeatEveryXSeconds
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: This allows to trigger an event every X seconds.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Convenience conditions, actions and behaviors for timers to trigger a condition every X seconds.

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds.

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds X amount of times.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Repeat every X seconds in X number
eventsFunctions.name: RepeatXTimes

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop
parameters.name: timerName

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger
parameters.name: time

parameters.longDescription: The condition will trigger at most this amount of times. Make it -1 for looping forever.
parameters.name: limit

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Allows to repeat an object timer every X seconds.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RepeatTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers every X seconds, where X is defined in the behavior properties.
eventsFunctions.name: Repeat

eventsFunctions.description: Pauses a recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

eventsFunctions.description: Resumes a paused recurring timer.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

eventsFunctions.description: Allows to trigger the recurring timer X times again.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetLimit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Allow to trigger the recurring timer _PARAM1_ of _PARAM0_ X times again

propertyDescriptors.label: The name of the timer to repeat
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerName

propertyDescriptors.label: The time between each trigger (in seconds)
propertyDescriptors.name: TimerLength

propertyDescriptors.label: How many times should the timer trigger? -1 for forever.
propertyDescriptors.name: Limit

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).
description: * __Paint effect:__ Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
effect type:
* __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
* __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
* __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
* __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Disable effect when the game starts.
Avoid default parameter of painter that could make the extension doesn't work.

Initialise position of painter. 
Increment or decrement "_TimeProgressionEffect" depending on direction.

Here this the paints functions of different effect depending on the type chosen by the user.
Detect the direction of the animation and its end.
Type 1 : flash effect.
Type 2 : screen come from top then return.
Type 3 : screen come from left then return.
Type 4 : a circle scale up from the middle then scale down.
The repeat 5 times is used to have clean and smooth edges , especially for circle.
Reset variables.

eventsFunctions.description: Paint Effect.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffect
eventsFunctions.sentence: Paint effect type _PARAM4_ of _PARAM0_ with direction _PARAM5_ and color _PARAM2_ for _PARAM3_ seconds

events.comment:
Initialise all variables and then activate the behavior.
If user doesn't assign value to color and type , we take the last value registred.
If user doesn't assign value to timer we take a default value (0.2).

eventsFunctions.description: Paint effect ended.
eventsFunctions.name: PaintEffectIsEnd

events.comment: Detect when the animation ends with a timer which is initialised in PaintEffect function.

propertyDescriptors.label: The maximum of the opacity only for flash
propertyDescriptors.name: MaxOpacity

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Turn any object into a cursor.
description: This extension allows to replace the cursor with an object.
Breaking change of the version 2.0.0:

- The button behavior has been removed. The button object can be used instead. Some ready to use buttons can be downloaded from the [Buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons) of the asset store.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turn any object into a mouse cursor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: cursor

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, @arthuro555
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CursorType
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
description: Provides an action to change the type of the cursor, and a behavior to change the cursor when an object is hovered.
Find the list of cursors here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor

eventsFunctions.description: Change the type of the cursor.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeCursorType

events.comment:
Set as variable instead of directly setting as a CursorHover behavior can override it.
By using a variable, we ensure to be able to change it back to that "default" after the override is over.
Reset ordering as the object with highest Z-Order might not exist anymore or be not be hovered anymore.
Set default value of the default cursor if the variable has just been created

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Change the cursor appearence when the object is hovered (on Windows, macOS or Linux).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: CursorHover

events.comment: Check the z Order to ensure the cursor shown is the one from the foremost object

inlineCode: // Set cursor to behavior property cursor_type

propertyDescriptors.label: The cursor type
propertyDescriptors.description: See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/cursor for a list of possible cursors.
propertyDescriptors.name: cursor_type

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BackButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Adds interactions with the back button.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Prevents the back button from quitting the game and provides a condition to check when it's pressed (to allow customising its behavior).

inlineCode: history.pushState("", ""); // Push a new fake state as the old one was popped
// Handle back button on the web
history.pushState("", ""); // Push a fake state to prevent switching page when clicking on back

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers whenever the player presses the back button.
eventsFunctions.name: onBackButtonPressed

eventsFunctions.description:
This simulates the normal action of the back button. 
This action will quit the app when in a mobile app, and go back to the previous page when in a web browser.
eventsFunctions.name: doDefault

inlineCode: // Close the app on cordova, as this is the default behavior
// Go to previous page as it is the default on browsers
// Remove the listener so new fake states don't get pushed
history.back(); // Remove the state that prevents going back

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @ddabrahim
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Drag camera with the mouse (or touchscreen)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
How to use:
- Run this action on every frame that you want the camera to be movable by the mouse (or touchscreen)
- Select the mouse button to use (choose "left" for touchscreen)
- Select which directions the camera will move (vertical, horizontal, or both)
- Select the layer that will be moved
Tips:
- If no parameters are selected, the camera will move in both directions when the left mouse button (or touchscreen) are dragged.

eventsFunctions.description: Move a camera by dragging the mouse (or touchscreen).
eventsFunctions.name: DragCameraWithPointer
eventsFunctions.sentence: Drag camera on layer _PARAM2_ in _PARAM3_ directions using _PARAM4_ mouse button

events.comment: When mouse button is pressed, get starting position of mouse
When mouse button is pressed, get current position of mouse and calculate distance between the previous and current position on X and Y axis
If selected direction is horizontal, both, or left blank, move camera on X axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel
If direction is vertical, both, or left blank, move camera on Y axis
Only move camera when the distance is more than one pixel

parameters.description: Directions that the camera can move (horizontal, vertical, both)
parameters.name: Direction
